overcome.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to successfully control a feeling or problem that prevents you from achieving something
overcome.translation[0].definitions[0].e: He struggled to overcome his shyness.
Her financial problems could no longer be overcome.
overcome.translation[0].definitions[1].d: if someone is overcome by smoke or gas, they become extremely sick or unconscious because they breathe it
overcome.translation[0].definitions[1].e: The engineer was working on the freezer when he was overcome by gas.
overcome.translation[0].definitions[1].n: Overcome is usually passive in this meaning
overcome.translation[0].definitions[2].d: if someone is overcome by emotion, they cannot behave normally because they feel the emotion so strongly
overcome.translation[0].definitions[2].n: Overcome is usually passive in this meaning
overcome.translation[0].definitions[3].d: to fight and win against someone or something
